metatags.twitter:title: Last Veteran of WWII Battle Group Marching Alone in Victory Day Parade
metatags.og:title: Last Veteran of WWII Battle Group Marching Alone in Victory Day Parade
metatags.twitter:creator: @knowyourmeme
metatags.og:description: Last Veteran of WWII Battle Group in Victory Day Parade refers to a photograph of an elderly veteran garbed in Russian military dress uniform wiping the tears from his eyes while marching down a street alongside a crowd of supporters. Since  2013, the photograph has gone viral on various social media platforms around the world, typically with the caption describing the man as the last surviving World War II veteran of his battlegroup marching alone at a commemorative parade.

title: Artists' Responses To The Holocaust - The Holocaust | IWM
htmlTitle: Artists' Responses To The Holocaust - The Holocaust | IWM
snippet: A number of the survivors who made their homes in Britain after the Second World War turned to art as an outlet for their trauma.
htmlSnippet: A number of the survivors who made their homes in Britain after the Second World War turned to art as an outlet for their trauma.

metatags.twitter:title: Artists' responses to the Holocaust
metatags.og:title: Artists' responses to the Holocaust
metatags.og:description: The artworks shown here explore a range of reactions to the Holocaust – from the deeply personal responses of survivors to the more documentary approach of official war artists recording the sights of Bergen-Belsen after its liberation in April 1945.
metatags.twitter:description: The artworks shown here explore a range of reactions to the Holocaust – from the deeply personal responses of survivors to the more documentary approach of official war artists recording the sights of Bergen-Belsen after its liberation in April 1945.
